verses.verse: The oracle<WH9294> concerning Tyre.<WH6865> Wail,<WH3213> O ships<WH591> of Tarshish,<WH8659> For [Tyre] is destroyed,<WH7703> without<WH4480> house<WH1004> [or] harbor;<WH935> It is reported<WH1540> to them from the land<WH776> of Cyprus.<WH3794>
Be silent,<WH1826> you inhabitants<WH3427> of the coastland,<WH339> You merchants<WH5503> of Sidon;<WH6721> Your messengers<WH4390> crossed<WH5674> the sea<WH3220>
And [were] on many<WH7227> waters.<WH4325> The grain<WH2233> of the Nile,<WH7883> the harvest<WH7105> of the River<WH2975> was her revenue;<WH8393> And she was the market<WH5504> of nations.<WH1471>

Be ashamed,<WH954> O Sidon;<WH6721> For the sea<WH3220> speaks,<WH559> the stronghold<WH4581> of the sea,<WH3220> saying,<WH559> "I have neither<WH3808> travailed<WH9123> nor<WH3808> given<WH3205> birth,<WH3205> I have neither<WH3808> brought<WH1431> up young<WH970> men<WH970> [nor] reared<WH7311> virgins.<WH1330>"
When<WH9201> the report<WH8088> [reaches] Egypt,<WH4714> They will be in anguish<WH9123> at the report<WH8088> of Tyre.<WH6865>
Pass<WH5674> over<WH5674> to Tarshish;<WH8659> Wail,<WH3213> O inhabitants<WH3427> of the coastland.<WH339>
Is this<WH384> your jubilant<WH5947> [city,] Whose origin<WH6927> is from antiquity,<WH6927> Whose feet<WH7272> used to carry<WH2986> her to colonize<WH1481> distant<WH7350> places?

Who<WH4310> has planned<WH3289> this<WH384> against<WH5921> Tyre,<WH6865> the bestower<WH5849> of crowns,<WH5849> Whose<WH834> merchants<WH5503> were princes,<WH8269> whose traders<WH9211> were the honored<WH3513> of the earth<WH776>?
The Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> has planned<WH3289> it to defile<WH2490> the pride<WH1347> of all<WH3605> beauty,<WH9469> To despise<WH7043> all<WH3605> the honored<WH3513> of the earth.<WH776>
Overflow<WH5674> your land<WH776> like the Nile,<WH2975> O daughter<WH1323> of Tarshish,<WH8659> There<WH369> is no<WH369> more<WH5750> restraint.<WH9253>

He has stretched<WH5186> His hand<WH3027> out over<WH5921> the sea,<WH3220> He has made the kingdoms<WH4467> tremble;<WH7264> The Lord<WH3068> has given<WH6680> a command<WH6680> concerning<WH413> Canaan<WH3667> to demolish<WH8045> its strongholds.<WH4581>

And He has said,<WH559> "You shall exult<WH5937> no<WH3808> more,<WH3254> <WH5750> O crushed<WH6231> virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Sidon.<WH6721> Arise,<WH6965> pass<WH5674> over<WH5674> to Cyprus;<WH3794> even<WH1571> there<WH8033> you will find<WH5117> no<WH3808> rest.<WH5117>"

Behold,<WH2005> the land<WH776> of the Chaldeans<WH3778> – this<WH2088> is the people<WH5971> [which] was not; Assyria<WH804> appointed<WH3245> it for desert<WH9478> creatures<WH9478> – they erected<WH6965> their siege<WH969> towers,<WH969> they stripped<WH6209> its palaces,<WH759> they made<WH7760> it a ruin.<WH9281>
Wail,<WH3213> O ships<WH591> of Tarshish,<WH8659> For your stronghold<WH4581> is destroyed.<WH7703>

Now it will come<WH1961> about in that day<WH3117> that Tyre<WH6865> will be forgotten<WH7911> for seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> like the days<WH3117> of one<WH259> king.<WH4428> At the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> it will happen<WH1961> to Tyre<WH6865> as [in] the song<WH9598> of the harlot: <WH2181>

Take<WH3947> [your] harp,<WH3658> walk<WH5437> about<WH5437> the city,<WH5892> O forgotten<WH7911> harlot;<WH2181> Pluck<WH5059> the strings<WH5059> skillfully,<WH3190> sing many<WH7235> songs,<WH7892> That you may be remembered.<WH2142>

And it will come<WH1961> about at the end<WH7093> of seventy<WH7657> years<WH8141> that the Lord<WH3068> will visit<WH6485> Tyre.<WH6865> Then she will go<WH7725> back<WH7725> to her harlot<WH2181>'s wages,<WH868> and will play<WH2181> the harlot with all<WH3605> the kingdoms<WH4467> on the face<WH6440> of the earth.<WH127>

And her gain<WH5504> and her harlot's wages<WH868> will be set<WH6944> apart<WH6944> to the Lord;<WH3068> it will not be stored<WH686> up or hoarded,<WH2630> but her gain<WH5504> will become<WH1961> sufficient<WH7654> food<WH398> and choice<WH6266> attire<WH4374> for those who dwell<WH3427> in the presence<WH6440> of the Lord.<WH3068>
